author: Special Correspondent
text:
Radio frequency identification (RFID) and e-seal are expected to be launched at Chennai port within a week or two.

Session

At a an interaction session with exporters and importers, organised by the Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry, Coimbatore, and the Chennai Port Trust, here on Tuesday Chennai Port Trust Chairman M.A. Bhaskarachar said that live demonstration of the use of RFID was held at the port on Tuesday.

It would be introduced for all vehicles so that they need not wait for manual checking for entry, said B. Vimal, traffic manager at the port.

The e-seal would be a part of the RFID programme. Mr. Bhaskarachar added that the problem of congestion had also been addressed at the port during the last 10-15 days.

Task force

A task force had been formed that monitored within the port and a group checked the trailers for documents outside the port area and this had brought down congestion.

When asked about rail service between Coimbatore and Chennai port, as offered between Coimbatore and Kochi port, for cargo movement Mr. Bhaskarachar said, “We have requested Concor to come out with a proposal.”

‘It will be introduced for all vehicles so that they need not wait for manual checking for entry’
title: RFID to be launched at Chennai port soon
